greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of zeros in 2^n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..20000 (first 1001 terms from Harry J. Smith)
program: (PARI) Count(x, d)= { local(c=0, f); while (x>9, f=x-10*(x\10); if (f==d, c++); x\=10); if (x==d, c++); return(c) }
{ for (n=0, 1000, a=Count(2^n, 0); write("b027870.txt", n, " ", a) ) } \\ _Harry J. Smith_, Oct 27 2009
xref: Cf. A031146: index of first appearence of n in this sequence.
Cf. A305932: table with n in row a(n).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
